result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Dushun Bowens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrence Dushun Bowens appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr appeared by video for Terrence Dushun Bowens.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Sanders-Barta.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Dushun Bowens not in court, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Terrence Dushun Bowens.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Givens has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Dushun Bowens not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JSB, FD, LNF, and DW
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Terrence Dushun Bowens in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Terrence Dushun Bowens in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrence Dushun Bowens appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
